sub_title: Graduate Student in Policy and Impact. Previous experience in entrepreneurship, capacity development, and investments
summary:
I am an entrepreneurial problem-solver, having collaborated with over 5,000 startups. As an investor, I participated in early-stage buy-and-sell-side transactions, assisted startups in acquiring their first customers, and designed products and ventures. As an innovation evangelist, I taught product and business strategy and led large-scale innovation initiatives for governments, corporations, and multilateral organisations.

I ventured into diverse sectors, charting previously uncharted territories, acquiring networks and knowledge along the way, taking significant risks in pursuit of excellence, and establishing myself as a significant player in the face of fierce competition. Whether in Deeptech Healthcare or Agri Supply Chain, I hustled through the 0-to-1 journey. My passions are problem solving, capacity development, enterprise development, and policy.

I enjoy working in unstructured, agile environments, articulating problems, scouting solutions, making sense, observing, and adapting. I am convinced that there is a method to the madness and a case for empathy in business.

If you have a challenging problem, I can help solve, please contact me at mainak@alumni.harvard.edu.

projects.title: Global Entrepreneurship Week (Kauffman Foundation)
projects.description:
•	Raised sponsorship and established India's biggest entrepreneurship arrangement – 12.7K participants, 171 inspiring events, and 63 partners; recipient of consistent praise for exceptional work ethic and attention to detail while operating under strict deadlines. 
•	Transformed GEW in India from <20 events the previous year after securing a new country partner.  
•	Achieved prestigious ‘Rookie of the Year’ (Global Entrepreneurship Congress 2014 at Moscow) due to superior results with GEW. 
•	Helped establish the program in India, leading to Indian Prime Minister and the US Govt. participating at it in subsequent years.

New Ventures | Business Head | Program Management | Growth

projects.title: Intel - DST Innovate for Digital India Challenge
projects.description:
•	Oversaw selection of 20 high-potential startups from 3000 applications which included healthcare, agritech, education, fintech, egov, and more; received commendations for business development acumen.
•	Forged productive alliances for impeccable execution, including managing stakeholder relationships with the University of California, Berkeley's Lester Center for Entrepreneurship; collaboratively led Accelerator program.
•	Handled budgeting covering USD $700k, designed a unique program, negotiated with Intel, established/mentored the operations team, and realized favorable positioning as a government liaison.
•	Received prestigious commendations from the Prime Minister, President of India and the respective Union Ministers of Electronics & IT and Science & Technology.

An Intel India project in collaboration with Department of Science & Technology (Govt. of India) and Govt. bodies Department for Electronics and Information Technology (DeitY) and MyGov as partners. the challenge aimed at fostering a culture of innovation, create solutions that can address local needs and build an empowered ecosystem for pervasive technology adoption in the country. 20 startups were selected from across the coutry for an extensive 6 month incubation program at CIIE Pune.

projects.title: Growthcamps
projects.description:
•	Spearheaded innovative new ‘product line’ involving specialized Corporate Innovation programs which emphasized solid investment theses, establishing a pipeline of 150 potential investments in the domains of Fintech, Cloud Computing, Security, Internet of Things, Analytics and Mobility. 
•	Implemented 3 Growthcamps (which included accelerated customer development) covering KPIT for Internet of Things, VMWare for Cloud Computing, and Fundtech (now D+H) and SunGard (now FIS) for Fintech with support from Clarice Technologies (now Globant); designated as a subject matter expert with program implementation and management, using innovative practices to enable stellar outcomes.
•	Cited as crucial in guiding 20 startups to be selected for potential mutual go-to-market partnerships or technology purchase at a global level.

projects.title: Last Mile Accelerator
projects.description: Backed by the Rockefeller Foundation and Artha Ventures and in partnership with Village Capital, a US based Accelerator promoted by First Light Ventures, the Last Mile Accelerator aimed to promote and help scale innovative health, energy, agriculture and financial inclusion startups serving the last mile population. A cohort of 12 teams were selected out of a total 200+ top applicants to undergo a 4 month long accelerator program. Rs. 60 lakhs were invested in the top two startups by CIIE and VilCap and more through syndication.

projects.title: Economic Times - Power of Ideas
projects.description:
•	Governed and supported a vital India project in collaboration with various government partners, effectively overcoming the challenge of fostering innovation culture, creating relevant and productive solutions, and constructing an empowered ecosystem to allow for significant and profitable technology adoption.
•	Exceeded all expectations and managed sponsorship and prize money from the Central Government and India’s largest media publication (USD $1.65M).
•	Overcame critical challenges by collaborating and managing communications with various internal teams, including direct alignment with the tech team; excelled in high-pressure situations with multiple objectives and dynamic timelines.
•	Attained record results in supporting 5-member team in managing the entire program for top 50 startups, including comprehensive investment analysis/structuring for 3 startups from 15k total applications; noted one of the most successful bplan competitions till date in India, and mentored the operating team during the subsequent editions of the program.

profile_positions.title: Mentor

profile_positions.description:
Innovated on customer development strategy, leading research into global markets and identifying key demographics. Strategized development of such innovations/products, including AI for HealthTech. Established co-development partnerships to successfully penetrate new business markets. Ensured rapid, efficient, and economical delivery of products, in collaboration with R&D and product teams.
•	Led GTM+product, securing position in healthcare industry alongside global competition, recognized by Gartner, Amazon, and Indian Government's Central Task Force on AI. 
•	Established pipeline of 30 potential enterprise customers, working with largest and most prestigious industry stakeholders.
profile_positions.title: Head of Product Strategy

profile_positions.description:
Led scouting, due diligence, and fund-raising for 10 start-ups within just 1 year. Consulted start-ups on design thinking and lean methodology. Represented organization in national media, positioning it as attractive funding platform for start-ups. Orchestrated process-driven initiatives, SOPs, and better governance campaigns driving stellar 80%-member participation among 70 UHNWI and HNWI angel investors. 
•	Established extensive professional network to attract country-wide deal-flow, conducting educational workshops for UHNWIs and start-ups on angel investing, product development, venture development, and customer empathy.  
•	Managed operations merger with Mumbai Angels, consolidating investment strength built in seven years of the organization's existence.
profile_positions.title: Chief Operating Officer

profile_positions.description: Spearheaded team of five in product development, while ensuring customer development and product-market fit. Provided innovative strategies to develop business via SaaS, supply chain, sustainability, and scalability.

company.name: Centre for Innovation Incubation and Entrepreneurship, IIM Ahmedabad

profile_positions.description:
Established high-performance team from scratch to coordinate IT investment activity (30% of total investment portfolio). Developed and coordinated several start-up incubator initiatives in collaboration with industry leaders, multilateral institutions, and government stakeholders. Applied in-depth knowledge of design thinking, lean/agile methodologies, and product strategy to guide start-ups towards mutual go-to-market partnerships and technology purchases at global level. Led pacesetting, globally situated teams of varying sizes towards optimal performance. 
•	Received multiple promotions from Program Associate to ICT Senior Manager, noted for contributions and strategic vision in raising funds from Corporates for crucial specific programs as well as attaining investment leverage ratio of 1:16 while managing asset growth of 4x to 100+ investments.
•	Facilitated one-of-a-kind campaign to assist in the flawless consolidation of CIIE's presence in new location, reaching out to high-profile ecosystem partners, including various departments of Indian Central and State Governments, VMware, Verisign, Intuit, SIDBI, SIEMENS, NASSCOM, Dassault, TCS, Amdocs, and more; garnered stakeholder buy-in for future activity. 
•	Spearheaded innovative new 'product line' involving specialized Corporate Innovation programs, which emphasized solid investment theses, establishing pipeline of 150 potential investments in the domains of Fintech, Cloud Computing, Security, Internet of Things, Analytics and Mobility.
